document.title: Religion Curriculum 2014 Archdiocese of Seattle Catholic Schools

ADD35ABF244D47D4B4E6AF9B372EB4DF.description:
Understand that Jesus calls
all to live the values he gave us in the Gospels.

1EC3A278F4A24562B8B7EFBE1DD36EE6.description:
Understand that all people
belong to God.

F374CAE23A02484DBF3A6FE2E57339F1.description:
Identify some of the ways that
Jesus showed compassion during his life on
Earth.

88E5440A9B87444F9C8F60AA044A138A.description:
CALL
TO ECUMENISM,
INTERFAITH
DIALOGUE AND THE
NEW
EVANGELIZATION
[848-849, 927-933, 905,
2044, 2472]

1AAAE76E4A214EEBB5A12ED8740E6E4C.description:
Identify each one’s responsibility
to share their time, talent and treasure with the
Church.

DDD3BA3DFC0C4677AAAE87777C4EA33D.description:
Recognize and use personal gifts
and talents to help others.

F1E8B5AD151C404998D29120844AE386.description:
We serve God by sharing our gifts
with the community, at whatever age we are in
life.

3521E4368CA0483BA914386F51BD185A.description:
CALL TO
STEWARDSHIP AND
SERVICE: Catholic
social teaching about
the common good
[2149-2422]
Scripture
Gen. 1:1-2:3; 2:7-25

ABFBB8C8FD28445CADF0A321DEC70FE6.description:
Demonstrate an understanding
of being sent from Mass to share God’s love with
others.

CDF89C8075D54B78B9674FACAD96E153.description:
Identify how we show our love
for Jesus by following Him through our actions.

E271DA313DC64343834DB60B9790B73A.description:
State that God calls each of us
to serve in special ways.

E3C10E22456A4D4DB95F8B40ACD9756F.description:
Explore ways that we live this
mission of the Church in our own lives.

FBD81E8EDD4E4D1FB4267ADD211CB820.description:
State and understand the
Church has a mission given to her by Jesus
Christ and we are all called by Baptism to
participate in this mission.

D02BDADAB214445B8F4492650AEB538F.description:
BAPTISMAL CALL AND
DISCIPLESHIP (the
mandate to go forth)
[816,849]
Scripture:
Mt. 28:18-20

4AF16EA5D34B403FA73DD9F93D6B1972.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 6: THE CHURCH’S MISSIONARY LIFE AND SERVICE: Students acquire and demonstrate skills to recognize their gifts from God and their
vocation to share the good News of Jesus Christ in word and deed in the world.

9EBB54FE1EED4DB39FC82B6E10944A63.description:
Relate the story of the
Annunciation and its importance for us as
followers of Jesus.

E4668A7CF9C14E738DFAC9AC9F3B6ECF.description:
Identify feast days that honor
Our Lady.

8D9185F101C64BCF874CBF0AEEE1663E.description:
Know titles of Mary: e.g.,
Mother of God, Mary Our Mother, and Mother
of the Church. (Resource: Litany of Loreto)

83BCA47946994E929CB9A30A96606A2A.description:
Know that each of us is called by
God and equipped to be a saint.

A2DAC14B661440C188AC2C93EE4A2BD4.description:
Know and celebrate the parish
patron saint.

6D1C3EC8EFE7400F8F0641BC521B1651.description:
Know some days that celebrate
the saints (memorials).

02F4A84E2A4E44B3B9E5490F18994D4D.description:
Identify the four primary
vocational roles: single person, married,
priests or consecrated religious.

65FFC25BC255411BBAC0D4A31BC5FAC4.description:
Understand that one must pray
to know one’s vocation.

2D38242DEB384217AA0AA9769871780F.description:
Know that everyone has a
vocation which is lived out in unique ways in
life and is a response to God’s plan for us.

579627C7DA524147A8DE783F84326331.description:
Know that a vocation is a gift
from God.

32FDDAEADEB54B2EAB33BE827D2B7ACB.description:
Vocation:
Marriage, priesthood
[914-933]
Scripture
1 Pet. 2:9
1 Sam. 3:1-10
Is. 6:1-8
Mt. 9:10:13
Mk. 1:16-20

8713510C08B4455BB0600C908F6BBE11.description:
Develop an understanding of
the Law of Love

281A1766E2B24CCBA1333FA250DB7D39.description:
State that God wants all to live
forever and be happy with Him in Heaven.

B54AD1266A094FD68E777BBEA4C8283B.description:
Identify how we show our love
for Jesus by following Him through our
actions.

762E88929F4A49CB90E41E10ABD1EC43.description:
Explain how being followers of
Jesus means that are to help others.

0E63CDAEF5B54CE2A8BFC0A22A8224FB.description:
Identify some “helps” to stay on
God’s path: Sacraments, talks with parents
and teachers.

C415CDB110DF454C9A25799D958DACD2.description:
Explain how regular
participation in the Sacraments of Eucharist
(Sunday and holy days of obligation) and
Reconciliation can help them to grow in virtue
and holiness.

82399848AA104196ABAD84BFC4CD16CD.description:
The
Universal Call to
Holiness
[2013-2014,2028,2813]
Scripture
1 Pet. 1:15-16
Lev. 11:44

8F5F3FFC3D31414C9AF26E3393CC3B35.description:
Recognize the family as the
domestic church.

E825149F12D247669CA40951E3367D90.description:
Explain how regular
participation in the sacraments of
Reconciliation and Eucharist help them grow
in holiness and virtue.

4F1F5724F01A4728843D8082C2AE93A1.description:
Recognize that by Baptism,
each person is called to be part of the Church.

893B426460934BC0AE75E9AD01F6685E.description:
Recognize the name of the
local parish and that the parish is the
gathering of God’s people to worship and
serve.

195BEFC1C99D4ED3B84C675D75CC42B1.description:
Understand that the Pope
leads the Catholic Church, a bishop leads a
diocese, and the pastor leads the local parish.

324A56E639864496AFD3EF97E88D97D5.description:
Church
Order: The Hierarchy
and Magisterium and
Infallibility
[874-896]

033B2F6B0E294D0CB2D3DCAF49173C12.description:
CHRIST’S
FAITHFUL:
HEIRARCHY, LAITY,
CONSECRATED LIFE:
[871-945]

561B274B06E04934AC2BE979F3A6E234.description:
Recognize that holiness is
being close to God.

3498DD35AB5F4DED866142A7FB3CE4E2.description:
MYSTERY
AND MARKS OF THE
CHURCH: One, Holy,
Catholic and Apostolic
[811-870]

495D7C186C064B0DBB0DDFE5222B3446.description:
Identify that God’s Holy Spirit
lives in each person and inspires us to be holy.

8A2E490D06BA454A96F3AD49272B408E.description:
Understand that all people are
made in the image and likeness of God.

AAC8C9E0334740A18686F06F3E516C70.description:
Temple of
the Holy Spirit
[797-801]
Scripture:
1 Cor. 6:19-20

A47DB7DCD4DA40CDAF78CC64955846E9.description:
Identify ways we share God’s
gifts as members of the Body of Christ.

1F0311C313314BADA17033A0D4A80E3A.description:
Understand that the parish is
where the People of God come to worship God
and serve others.

0D4BD9957EDD4C949CB82B3C107FF878.description:
Recognize family and friends
comprise a parish/school community.

C5B6349C82634EB78C61E8E036152712.description:
Locate places where Jesus lived
using a map of the Holy Land.

E62A50FEB5DE4048980367A6B4838E0D.description:
THE CHURCH
IN GOD’S PLAN
[748-780]
Church History
[758-780
Scripture:
Acts 2:1-13

5F35FE60A59B41B2BAA6BF038A02A5E0.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 5: THE LIFE, COMMUNITY AND HISTORY OF THE CHURCH: Students study and participate in the life and mission of the church, the Body of
Christ and the community of believers, as expressed in the Church’s origin, history, ecclesiology, the Communion of Saints and their family, the domestic church.

6BAC5484CD764818A1918A400D4BFC56.description: Agnus Dei/Behold the Lamb of God

83D79802513248EB9DA435F466C4153E.description:
Responses after all Lectionary
readings and before Gospel

3F412C5B3540443486F77EC38E996410.description:
Antiphonally psalms from the Liturgy of
the Hours – Psalm 23

8649A677CD334B25A5FAEEC9AC3F698D.description:
Prayers of blessing, adoration, praise,
intercession, thanksgiving, petition

0D5E74F862124BA3851C0FF529D4862D.description:
PRAYERS WE
KNOW BY HEART,
EXPERIENCE AND
SHARE AT MASS

B4C9015BA5F045CE9F68B4FBB1768AB3.description:
Experience the Rosary as a special
prayer using beads and praying about the
mysteries of Jesus’ life.

9E2CD90F9F1B4FC8894626412EF5643E.description:
DEVOTIONAL
PRACTICES (e.g.
Rosary, Stations of the
Cross, Novenas)
[1200-1209, 1674-1679,
2683-2696]

35799D76B3304D039AE652D2EE023420.description:
Find when the “Our Father” is prayer
during the liturgy.

A9AF2BB0443F445188B71A3AF4C30660.description:
Recite the “Our Father” and explain
understanding of the prayer.

B04AC5550AE841938A8FE6A030003CBF.description:
OUR FATHER:
Summary of the Gospel
[2746-2865]
Scripture:
Mt. 6:9-13
Lk. 11:1-13

E8F693DF4B97465A91C0267E1AAE3D75.description:
Reflect quietly on a passage from
sacred Scripture.

4BAB218648BB48A68D6C5DE4F55F7D9F.description:
Recognize that we pray with the
community of the Church especially at Mass on
Sunday.

5B88D6A53E984429B5F81BA00D5DE67C.description:
Demonstrate ways to practice being
more like Jesus through personal prayer.

7E5439DF86A84C2F93BFEFAE0527E47F.description:
Recognize that we pray alone and
with others.

C29FC2A705FC4831A5D5A51DF1B58A44.description:
EXPRESSIONS
OF PRAYER (vocal
meditation,
contemplation,
personal and shared)
[2700-2724]

D9381041F0B04574B4A4F1966CE34749.description:
State that God forgives us when we
ask for his mercy in prayer.

7E2CD1BE2FD3435FAE5A4AACAA3EAC6A.description:
Understand that in the Mass we thank
God for all the blessings given to us, we offer our
lives to God, especially for the gift of his Son.

5189AC3ABE3A44F8AEDC91CF25AA796A.description:
Know and experience various forms
of prayer: blessing, adoration, petition,
intercession, thanksgiving, praise.

63889ED3C35447119B993453555F6BE7.description:
FORMS OF
PRAYER
(Blessing, Adoration
Petition, Intercession
Thanksgiving, Praise)
[2623-2649]
Scripture:
Psalms

47D9B83F3C1A414C882C4EE892045885.description:
Know that prayer is essential to our
life with God and part of Christian life.

64C4BF5D9E2C46E8B7EDC38806AFB9B4.description:
Explain in own words the importance
of praying.

EB73E31F4B134E969E84405F1D7C271B.description:
Experience prayer as a way to talk
and listen to God.

1A0E18374B38413CB5F0059C4EA97905.description:
THE UNIVERSAL
CALL TO PRAYER,
IMPORTANCE OF
PRAYER
[2558-2758]
Scripture:
Mt. 6: 5-15

0B39F347C67545CEA0B29D9648C0E309.description: TASK OF CATECHESIS 4 – TEACHING TO PRAY: Students experience and engage in Catholic expressions of prayer to deepen their relationship with God and the Church.

F9BF97CC74964F369EA22D08E7C9E523.description:
Participate and reflect on age
appropriate service projects.

8710023E288A47CE82124E04FFF4BD84.description:
Understand work in school is an
expression of one of God’s gifts.

8497A81CC1AC490AAD4363F9EA7F1C36.description:
Know that all work deserves
respect.

5393E995C2184175A5CF6C1D72E4F026.description: Describe what it means to be poor.

809349BF21984171996CF257A7165B4F.description:
Understand that every person must
have a sense of responsibility for all other
people.

68C90ED0BEC045F4B51F80BC2BCCB33E.description:
Practice care of personal
belongings, classroom, school building, and
parish grounds.

08B32D020ECF4494AAD05982D881E573.description:
Cultivate an appreciation for all
levels of creation.

2D5B98476DE34C89A13D27D686CF74B4.description:
Appreciate creation as a gift from
God. Recognize the responsibility to care for the
gift of creation.

75964AE73A1E498BAEFAA7793960EE86.description:
Catholic
Social Teachings –
Consistent Ethic of
Life, Love of Neighbor,
and the Corporal and
Spiritual Works of
Mercy
[2419-2449]
Scripture
Gen. 1:1-18; 2: 1-25

6C1D9079B0F240DD971429F182A34D54.description:
Identify the Penitential Rite during
the liturgy as a time to show sorrow for sin and
to ask God for forgiveness. (Lord, have mercy.)

94362328E8CF47EC881340042F8686A4.description:
Discuss why the Sacrament of
Reconciliation is important to living as a child of
God.

5FFC923AEC3F43DBB2E42344CA89493A.description:
Name how God’s help enables us
to avoid sin.

2048E081B768451F9465EA3384B9DBB2.description:
State that God forgives our sins no
matter how serious they are, and Identify ways
to make up for sin.

A95D8F4176D1494885AE434F7F519D7C.description:
Give examples of how sin affects
their relationship with God, neighbor, and
creation.

E4D2857883AD4892A8A2CF86E5E2A712.description: Define venial sin and mortal sin.

B6758ACF850C417AA6B57A518DCC075E.description:
Define sin as choice we make to
turn away from God and repentance as turning
back to God.

C83AB53D85024915BBAD8AF84FE58FC2.description:
Distinguish the difference among
temptation, accident and sin.

32CDB8C99EC54F9184962878B8DEE439.description:
Personal and
Social Sin
[1846-1876]
Scripture:
Gen. 2:7-25;3:1-24; 4:1-
16

DA4513ACC6EA4B5B829071C2E84F7275.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
dignity, respecting the rights of others.

7E01AE6655EE480DB5DB25B0D0BB2C1B.description:
Identify ways human beings are
different from other creatures.

D965F46BEFB246EFADE3B922C933A195.description:
Understand that responsibilities are
responses to our God-given rights.

495A13F43A9C42EBA93B535DECCBC5D4.description:
Recognize that God’s help enables
us to grow in virtue and grace.

9FC3B69C8E23469EABD48E32ACAD1138.description:
Name a virtue, describe it as a
good habit that helps us love as God loves us,
and recognize that virtue is a choice.

1101A2F4DCB549318885B1D5155FA7F6.description:
Virtues
Cardinal and
Theological
[1803-1845, 2656-2662]
Scripture:
Col. 1:9-14
Ph. 4:4-9
Prov. 19:1

90404466696645F2B6DF7BCAB712C924.description:
Describe God’s “Covenant
Relationship” in own words

048A5A4B70684B9790D998884F0B0743.description:
Know the Ten Commandments
are laws given to us by God to help us respect
and love one another.

7AEE3C4E7CF24F6A84D701DFDD0D0AD4.description:
Covenant and
Ten Commandments
[2052-2557]
Scripture:
Ex. 19: 16-20 – 20:17
Ex. 24:1-12
Mt: 22:34-40
Mk. 12:28-34

8E73775AF4F641C8991F41E2075B9900.description:
Understand and experience the
examination of conscience.

D65BB4FBF9744C65B04597E818F8732D.description:
Identify conscience as God’s gift
to distinguish between right and wrong.

E4066E7DE7CD4F1880AFCE232DB9A163.description:
Understand that God gave us an
intellect and free will to choose what is right
and avoid what is evil.

C9A3BBA241F643F78835CADF2DC078E6.description:
Understand how following God’s
rules help us to be happy, healthy, and holy.

379A309011824D459BF6BF3BEA606B0F.description:
Recognize that we are made in
God’s image and likeness to know, love and
serve God and to be happy with Him forever.

BCCE64C3572C4FA5AA765C57C1F4455B.description:
Made for
Happiness with God,
Beatitudes
[1218-1229, 1716-1717]
Scripture
Mt. 5:3-10
Prov. 3:21-35

0B05C8BB6156486A936C187EC253816D.description:
Explain how our bodies are created
by God to be respected by ourselves and others.

A516795E13C34B1E8475FDA152688F10.description:
Articulate that they are created in
God’s image.

2CB61387DC9E4610AFE6F002E765486C.description:
Made in the
Image of God –
Foundation of Human
Dignity
[355-368, 1004, 1700-
1876]
Scripture
1 Cor. 6:19-20

221EE8C2BC274D73A4A58759433C14D4.description:
Begin to understand that Eucharist
offers us a great gift in fulfilling our human desire
to be close to God.

34A8A49D281647A98549DEBAC8381A68.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 3 – MORALITY / LIFE IN CHRIST: Students develop a moral conscience that is informed by Church teachings and conformed to Christ, as modeled
in a personal life of virtue and demonstrated in service of the Gospel’s demands for society

E304C32580B740DBA956DA83BC77F674.description:
Understand that Christian funerals
are celebration of our life in Christ.

636AFCCF677442A3919A386BF952299D.description:
Understand that Catholic marriage
(Holy Matrimony) is a sacrament with special
blessings for the couple to love one another as
Christ modeled for all.

868EFCA7906C4B7392ECB04CAEF372F8.description:
Liturgical Rites:
Weddings, [1621- 1637]
Funerals [988-1029, 1680-1690]
and Blessings [1671-1673

83F49F4DE0C14F968FD17D9088642EF4.description:
Listen to and discuss the grade
level recommended psalms during prayer.

02997E3FDA574773B5944D2A79E4D5EB.description:
Make the Sign of the Cross when
responding to the invitatory, “Lord open my lips”
with “And my mouth will proclaim your praise.”

6301943E0555416EACB612F1E3B23D2B.description:
Recognize the Liturgy of the Hours
as the public prayer of the Church.

9EEE04A78FDC4DB986B60B7B65BB10A4.description:
Divine Office
Liturgy of the Hours
[1174-1178]
Scripture:
Psalms 23, 67 and 51

65D96D81441C4169A2694C1801D1DB70.description:
Know that sacramentals are holy
actions and holy objects: e.g., laying on of hands,
genuflecting, sign of the cross, blessed ashes,
blessed medals, and blessed candles.

7B77FF2AE21F4F40B45175C472769959.description:
Identify the difference between a
sacrament and a sacramental.

C9DA0813203A467BB4DB4D641825DE3E.description:
Define sacramentals as holy
actions and objects.

B0976BDBC98745228CF69E546F6C34DD.description:
Identify Holy Week and Easter as the
holiest days of the year, when we remember
Jesus’ passion, death, and resurrection, the
Paschal Mystery.

77F7C2C7AFDE4E198DAD0B1D8C7A2871.description:
Identify the seasons as celebrations
of the life of Jesus, Christ, Mary and the saints.

12EC4D74EA34434DB86F8EA219208C96.description:
Chart the seasons of the Church
year associating the appropriate colors.

4ECD9A93B8CA416C8F8418AFF928F3B6.description:
State that some are called to serve
the Church as ordained deacons, priests, or
bishops.

8C2D403D711B4548BEAD33AA0E609CFF.description:
Recognize marriage is between one
man and one woman, who together make a
promise to be partners for life.

003E3A2E6E4643CFA1B04A523A4CE186.description:
Identify and describe the two
Sacraments in Service of Communion:
Marriage and Holy Orders.

59966B2058B7486EAD154338EA84448C.description:
Sacraments at the
Service of Communion
[1533-1666]
Scripture:
Ex. 19:16-20:17

48415E896A9F4C2482A3FDE880107FA6.description:
Explain absolution as God
forgiving their sins in the Sacrament of
Reconciliation and Penance.

4F4E232AFD214C03B541877E91831FFC.description:
Be able to examine one’s
conscience.

FADF094DB64F4EAD81DF70D3F1DFCC48.description:
Identify and explain in own words
the essential elements in the Rite of receiving
the Sacrament of Penance/Reconciliation
including examination of conscience,
confession of sin, contrition, penance and
absolution.

FCD79C4AA7554C06B088BD27196FDF70.description:
Articulate the Sacraments of
Healing Penance/Reconciliation and
Anointing of the Sick as Sacraments in which
they encounter Jesus, the Healer.

84131BD46E1449289A305B5818F28032.description:
Sacraments of Healing
[979-987, 1420-1484]]
Scripture:
Gen. 37:1-36; 45:1-28
Lk. 15:11-32

09CC4EDB10954A3DB5039AC8883C213B.description:
Begin to understand the effects
(the change that is the result of receiving the
Sacraments) of the Sacrament of Baptism.

691B347E088C414AA377AE4C799086E7.description:
Explain that Baptism is the first
sacrament and it is followed by Holy
Communion and Confirmation.

6A0B1A2102E545139D94C7F30F7C67D6.description:
Identify the Sacraments of
Initiation as the foundation of one’s
participation in the life of the Church.

34CD3AC9767C4C419FBEA558CFD4140F.description:
Define grace as a gift from God that
helps each of us grow in holiness.

5362AEC8C8B44481ABA5451FD5CC0528.description:
Describe the meaning of a sacrament
as effective signs of God’s grace.

54B0150A4AD1460C9F7363F2F2BBB3B2.description:
CELEBRATION OF THE
SACRAMENTS
[1210-1666] Scripture
Acts 15: 10-11
1 Cor. 15:10

F5C8410C82A347968064153B956DA0D2.description:
With guidance from the teacher, as a
class, prepare a liturgy based on a chosen
theme or feast day. Include in the
preparation: readings, intercessory prayers
and music.

85D03EFB87CB4E08A32A082B1EC735E9.description:
Recognize the obligation to attend
Mass on Sundays and Holy Days of
Obligation.

3FE582C6178A4DADBA6447F420AB9730.description:
State that the priest ends the Mass
by sending us forth to do good works in the
world.

00A8E7F75BF64B50A3372E43C05A1729.description:
Exhibit reverence for Holy
Communion as the Real Presence of Jesus
Christ present in the bread and wine.

5A61FB6371114186B46C606DB61B0F85.description:
Explain that the priest presides at
the Eucharistic liturgy, he consecrates the
bread and wine into the Body and Blood of
Jesus.

5DF706EC69EE4909B4ABD2504B234FCB.description:
Recognize the connection with the
Last Supper and the celebration of Mass.

F52D019942A54BDE90841109D04FD14F.description:
Explain that at the prayer over the
gifts of bread and wine we present these gifts
to God asking that God be blessed for these
gifts.

B9C1C059000C484880A198F96FAB69C0.description:
Recognize the difference between
bread and wine and the Body and Blood of
Christ.

477FF088916E469F8DEB41101A8D5077.description:
State that in the Mass we give thanks
for all of God’s gifts, especially for the gift of
His son, Jesus Christ.

8FD4112EDF7D4B6192A241F7EB91DC8A.description:
State that the stories of Jesus in the
Gospels are proclaimed during the
Eucharistic celebration.

350AF3BD4B65496D9EA2076CD7C0374D.description:
Explain that the Mass is the
celebration of the Paschal Mystery, the life,
death, and resurrection of Jesus Christ.

A43E60DBF09D47CBA83F07F523BFE8F2.description:
Demonstrate appropriate liturgical
gestures when participating in liturgy.

983145DBD275416EA7AEE95C09BEC67F.description:
Understand that at the beginning of
Mass, we tell God we are sorry for our sins
and ask for God’s forgiveness.

8A59E1958BB3405CB2847FD816C22B39.description:
Identify two high points of the Mass:
proclamation of the Gospel and the
consecration of the Eucharist.

53BEDCB43F634A28A385E73281E68B00.description:
Begin to understand the four parts of
the Liturgy: Introductory Rites, Liturgy of
the Word, Liturgy of the Eucharist,
Concluding Rite.

C3B60F4AA5374A3EB2A3E8D23561FF94.description:
Recognize that ministers of the altar
(priests, deacons, altar servers) wear
vestments.

04F53F7B9D0A41A0A874CEC28BA7FB67.description:
Sing/recite Mass responses with
other students.

75CF89AFF16A4235BD8F11349655354C.description:
Begin to understand that Sunday is
the Lord’s Day, and we participate in Mass to
worship, praise and thank God.

4DDD1FC085BF419196F736A8B36221DC.description:
Understand liturgy as the public
worship of the Church.

6844EB93AD1A4DA5A0AF6A0B02D4312B.description:
EUCHARIST Who, How, When, and Where
the Mass is Celebrated
[1135-1167, 1322-1419]
Scripture
Ex. 16:1-35
Mt. 26:25-30
Mk. 14:12-26
Lk. 22:14-20
1 Cor. 11:23-27

C5F76A43C2FB44BEB9B091AE570A8B05.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 2 – LITURGICAL EDUCATION: Students recognize the presence of Christ and enter into communion with Him through active, full and conscious
participation in the Liturgical celebrations and Sacraments of the Church.

135DC181DCDD40DAB744F8F287E2534B.description:
Know the Nicene Creed is the one we
usually profess at Mass, and the Apostles Creed
is recited with the Rosary.

E64C43ED3FC44D1B9E773AB115DA9590.description:
Restate definition of Creed in own
words.

1CD421CC748A4F2A9E4C46F2B0ADB1DC.description:
THE CREED, A
STATEMENT OF OUR BELIEF
[185-1065]
Scripture
Gen. 2:17
Rom. 6:23
2. Tim. 1:9-10

2C449E30DE8149C98DA46F5D66A89644.description:
Recognize God the Holy Spirit lives
within us, gives us the gift of grace, and helps
us make right choices.

CE128646A7274D858D76651F00277752.description:
Articulate an understanding that
Jesus is God’s Son, the promised Savior.

C0598FE6E9BF48488161762F3CE53C2C.description:
Name the Trinity as the central
Mystery of our faith.

88C05ADD7A694D50AF58BC5CD9A6C276.description:
Name and explain three persons of
the Trinity: three persons in one God.

4182174588A44B7A85426CB68147ACCE.description:
GOD THE CREATOR,
JESUS THE REDEEMER, AND
HOLY SPIRIT AS SANCTIFIER
[249-324]
Scripture:
Gen. 1:20-31
Mt. 28:16-20
Mk. 1:9-11
Lk 3:21-22
Rom. 8:26-27

F9805F6E3BD741A087D20B8F5AC84E4D.description:
Show understanding of Jesus as the
Bread of Life as found in John’s Gospel.

91ADF4674F2F4A2EAD7788740DBB11E5.description:
Know that Jesus wants to be with us
always and gives Himself to us in the Eucharist.

87A6C565DF0743A5BF9AD3567E36CF7E.description:
Explain Incarnation as Jesus is both
the Son of God and Son of Mary; Jesus is truly
God and truly man.

BB6C6BF58DC849E691ACC898998329D6.description:
Explain that Jesus is God’s Son and
the promised Savior.

E05FAF3438984E0E9F4B9DA32E98E5AB.description:
Recognize sacred stories from the
Bible where God redeems his people

12C4656426134714A2739A752D2011B7.description:
Begin to understand that God the
Father sent God the Son, Jesus Christ as our
Redeemer.

ADECCACD193B4E558ECB326EF19D71D0.description:
Retell stories of Jesus’ birth, Last
Supper, death, resurrection and ascension.

E853F5A63CD948BAB178D25AB6FFA513.description:
Salvation History
[50-73]
Scripture:
Genesis
Exodus
John 3:16-18

F76CF9298C5141BDBFC3C6D5F36BB44C.description:
Retell the Creation and the Fall
narrative in own words: e.g. sin, freedom, and
grace.)

35D8A0AE4FD14C3C9384E46B164E78C2.description:
Retell miracle stories of Jesus
related to the Eucharist.

9601FD9881114740BF2656BC02490952.description:
Retell Gospel passages illustrating
Jesus’ love for all when he was with us on earth.

675229D5D51B477B94F60270DB458A66.description:
Identify that stories of Jesus are only
found in the New Testament.

938ED19FDFD748A69978C8A6B6F43E15.description:
Locate Old Testament and New
Testament in the Bible.

4BB86D471FD045D690FF4A036CE90D2A.description:
Recall that the Bible as a sacred
collection of books about God’s love for us and
how to live as God’s children

EFD19FC7015E4257BB2515E865A001B0.description:
Begin to understand that God reveals
Himself fully by sending us his own Divine Son,
Jesus Christ.

6A3CFAA26D8B4076856005EAEACA58F1.description:
Recognize that each person is made
in the image and likeness of God and meant to
live forever with God.

DCCD126FEED64732A886ABB54DDB6330.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 1 – KNOWLEDGE OF THE FAITH: Students explore, profess and reflect on our Catholic faith, which is the content of God’s revelation found in
Sacred Scripture and Sacred Tradition and lived out in the Creed and Church doctrine.
